official_title: A concurrent resolution expressing the sense of the Congress that certain mailing privileges should be granted to members of the Armed Forces of the United States and certain others in Lebanon.

summary.text: Expresses the sense of Congress that the President should designate Lebanon as an overseas area from which mail from a member of the armed forces of the United States or a friendly foreign nation may be sent postage free to a place within the delivery limits of a U.S. post office.

titles.title: A concurrent resolution expressing the sense of the Congress that certain mailing privileges should be granted to members of the Armed Forces of the United States and certain others in Lebanon.
